DataElement.preferredName: Health Care Provider Instruction Six Mercaptopurine Not Received Data Unknown Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A single character text field to indicate if instructions by a health care provider regarding how/when to take 6MP was not received.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Health Care Provider Instruction Six Mercaptopurine Not Received
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care._A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one._A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)_A message describing how something is to be done._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To take, accept, or get something offered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities, or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Concepts.definition: Persons who provides health care as part of their job responsibilities: or a person or organization who is licensed to supply health care.

Property.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.:A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04):An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:A message describing how something is to be done.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 5 and less than 7 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of five and one.

A thiopurine-derivative antimetabolite with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  Produced through the metabolism of mercaptopurine by hypoxanthine-guanine phosphoribosyltransferase (HGPRT), mercaptopurine metabolites 6-thioguanosine-5'-phosphate (6-thioGMP) and 6-thioinosine monophosphate (T-IMP) inhibit nucleotide interconversions and de novo purine synthesis, thereby blocking the formation of purine nucleotides and inhibiting DNA synthesis.  This agent is also incorporated into DNA in the form of deoxythioguanosine, which results in the disruption of DNA replication. In addition, mercaptopurine is converted to 6-methylmercaptopurine ribonucleoside (MMPR) by 6-thiopurine methyltransferase; MMPRs are also potent inhibitors of de novo purine synthesis. (NCI04)
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To take, accept, or get something offered.
A message describing how something is to be done.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a single character text field to record data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have not received any instruc
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have not received any instructions regarding how/when to take 6MP
